Persib Tak Kebobolan di 3 Laga Terakhir Liga 1, Begini Kata Jupe
04 Nov 2019, 12:57 by Aminuddin, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Bek tengah Persib Bandung, Achmad Jufrianto, mengatakan cukup senang dengan perolehan clean-sheet alias tidak kebobolan dalam tiga laga terakhir yang dijalani. Hal ini menjadi kebanggaan tersendiri bagi pemain belakang.
Meski begitu, pemain yang akrab disapa Jupe itu lebih mementingkan kemenangan bagi Persib daripada hanya bisa nirbobol. Persib tercatat tak kebobolan saat melawan Bhayangkara FC, Persija Jakarta dan Kalteng Putra. Dua pertandingan terakhir Persib menang dengan skor 2-0.
"Insyaallah (bisa nirbobol) tapi yang terpenting memenangkan pertandingan lah gitu. Walaupun clean-sheet atau enggak, intinya hasilnya, yang penting menang dulu saja," kata Jupe usai latihan rutin di Stadion Si Jalak Harupat, Kabupaten Bandung, Senin, 4 November 2019.
Jupe mengatakan saat ini tugas pemain Persib yakni bisa mempertahankan ritme bermain. Berhasil tak terkalahkan dalam empat laga sebelumnya harus bisa dipertahankan Jupe dan kawan-kawan.
"Ya intinya kita harus tetap bisa menjaga ritme itu. Di setiap latihan kita harus jaga mood setiap pemain, mental setiap pemain. Kita harua ingat bagaimana kita mengambil poin penuh di beberapa pertandingan away. Nah itu yg harus kita ingat-ingat itu," ujarnya.
Selanjutnya, Persib akan menjamu PSIS Semarang dalam laga lanjutan Liga 1 2019. Pertandingan itu rencananya akan digelar di n Si Jalak Harupat, Kabupaten Bandung, Rabu, 6 November 2019, mendatang.
Melihat performa PSIS yang cukup bagus dalam laga terakhir, Jupe mengaku cukup kaget dengan PSIS, yang sukses membantai PSS Sleman dengan skor 3-0. Laga itu dilangsungkan di Stadion Maguwoharjo, Sleman, Sabtu, 2 November 2019.
"Agak mengejutkan, kemarin kita juga ada sebagian pemain yang nonton pada saat PSIS lawan Sleman. Mereka mungkin bisa menang meski dengan statusnya home tapi mainnya di Sleman. Agak mengejutkan juga karena yang dilawan PSS Sleman, bukan tim yang biasa-biasa saja," ucap dia. Persib kini menempati peringkat kedelapan klasemen sementara Liga 1 dengan torehan 34 poin dari 25 pertandingan..
AMINUDDIN A.S.
text:
Persib Not conceded in the last 3 League 1 matches, Jupe said
Nov. 04 2019, 12:57 by Aminuddin, Hari Prasetyo
TEMPO.CO, Bandung - Persib Bandung central defender, Achmad Jufrianto, said that he was quite happy with the acquisition of clean sheets, which was not conceded in the last three games he played. This is a matter of pride for the defender.
Even so, the player who is familiarly called Jupe was more concerned with winning for Persib than just being able to breakthrough. Persib recorded not conceding against Bhayangkara FC, Persija Jakarta and Central Kalimantan Putra. The last two matches Persib won with a score of 2-0.
"Insyaallah (it can be a breakdown) but the most important thing is to win the match. Although clean-sheet or not, the point is the result, the important thing is to win first," said Jupe after routine training at Si Jalak Harupat Stadium, Bandung Regency, Monday, November 4, 2019 .
Jupe said that currently the task of Persib is to maintain the rhythm of playing. Successfully undefeated in the previous four matches must be defended by Jupe and his friends.
"Yes, the point is we must still be able to maintain that rhythm. In each exercise we must maintain the mood of each player, mentally every player. We must remember how we take full points in several away matches. Now that's what we have to keep in mind," he said .
Furthermore, Persib will host PSIS Semarang in the 2019 League 1 continued match. The match is planned to be held at the Starling Harupat, Bandung Regency, Wednesday, November 6, 2019, coming.
Seeing the performance of PSIS which was quite good in the last match, Jupe admitted that he was quite surprised by PSIS, who successfully slaughtered PSS Sleman with a score of 3-0. The match was held at the Maguwoharjo Stadium, Sleman, Saturday, November 2, 2019.
"Somewhat surprising, yesterday we also had a part of the players who watched during PSIS against Sleman. They might be able to win even though they were home but they played in Sleman. It was rather surprising also because the one opposed by PSS Sleman was not a mediocre team," said he. Persib is now ranked eighth in the League 1 standings with 34 points from 25 matches ..
AMINUDDIN U.S.
